title: How this website knows that I'm an existing user?
content: I'm not an expert so my apologies for any ignorance or "non technical" talk. I've an account on a website. I signed out and then revisit that website as a guest and they says "Welcome Back". I tried to chat with online agent and they know that I'm an existing user. (Although they didn't mention my user name etc but still they know that I often visit their site.) I clear all relevant cookies of that website and even restarted Firefox but still the same situation. Even I tried to use a VPN but same. Just curious how do they know that I've been visiting this website before. Thanks for help.

title: My Firefox crushed and cannot install a new version in Mac
content:
Hello,

The Firefox I was using was crushed entirely and lost all my passwords, bookmarks, etc. The app's folder is not accessible. Then I downloaded a new version, and when I tried to open the app, a dialogue box said Firefox was trying to install a helper. Cancel does not work, and the "OK" stops the opening. I have a Mac with an OS Sequoia 15.

I tried to transfer the json, place.., key4, etc by copying from the old information i have, but the system does not work.

Thank you for your needed help.

Horacio Bach

title: If Google is shifting toward topic authority over keyword targeting, how can websites build trust in a niche faster than competitors?
content:
Google increasingly ranks topic authorities, not just pages with optimized keywords. To build trust faster than competitors, focus on: 1. Topical Clusters > Single Articles Create clusters of related content that fully cover your niche.


Main pillar page


6‚Äì12 supporting subtopics


Internal links connecting everything


This signals depth and expertise.

2. Satisfy Search Intent Better Than Existing Results Analyze top 5 ranking pages:


What‚Äôs missing?


Which questions aren‚Äôt answered?


What unique angle or data can you add?


Google rewards content that solves the user‚Äôs problem fastest.

3. Expertise Proof (E-E-A-T Signals) Add:


Author bio with experience


Case studies


Original data, screenshots, processes


Real results


This builds instant credibility.

4. Strong Internal Linking Strategy Internal links pass authority within your site. Use:


Contextual links


Links from high-traffic pages to new pages


Relevant anchor text


Think of internal links as your ‚ÄúSEO currency.‚Äù

5. Fix Technical https://serpgine.com https://serpgine.com SEO Early Even the best content won‚Äôt rank if:


Crawl depth is too high


Pages load slowly


Mobile CLS issues exist


JS blocks indexing


A fast, clean structure accelerates authority building.

title: External open specific url will open on container
content:
I've exactly the same problem as described here. https://support.mozilla.org/de/questions/1442833

> For some reason, in my firefox profile, when I try to access > "https://accounts.google.com", it open on new tab with a specific > container, while other url keep open with no container. I've never > configure this behavior, or found a setting to fix it.

This is a privacy problem, because most of the time when I open a website like google.com, I don't want to be logged in so the website can identify me. I only keep a container tab for such a website around, so I can open it if I explicitly want to be logged in.
creator: kolAflash
